name: places/ChIJzeYtaVhYwokRToMBBAqpLK4
formattedAddress: 322 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 322 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text: I used this place for over two years until a nasty encounter with the desk lady Arlene left a terrible enough impression to never want to come back again.  I called to point out a mistake they made in forgetting to repair something they charged me for.  Rather than offer any remedy Arlene was extremely rude on the phone and hung up on me.  The pricing has also gone up a lot since I first used them - it's around 7 dollars to dry clean one shirt.

originalText.text:
After spending money at this dry cleaners on a regular basis....they return my over $300 suitpants soiled with multiple stains that didn’t exist in the first place...then despite the fact that I still have a dry cleaning tag on it claim I’ve used the pants, and they won’t dry clean the pants again....like anyone goes to a work meeting with a bright pink tag on it?

It’s no wonder why this place has accumulated many one stars. I’ll be sure to take the hundreds of dollars of business I’ll spend on dry cleaning the next few years and spend it somewhere else. Maybe take a class in microeconomics & maybe actually treat your customers with respect. A defensive, shouting tone as you enter without even articulating the compliant is reason alone to not give this place business.

originalText.text:
I had been sending my wash and fold and dry clean to Valet on 57th for a long time - always telling the delivery guy which bad was which - The dry cleaning versus the laundry. Somehow THEY WASHED ALL OF MY SUITS. How does someone wash a suit in a machine? Who doesn’t flag that?

BUT THERES MORE....

A satellite store opened on 56th Street under the Shelbourne. I was not aware of the connection. I started using them.

Last week I happened to look at my AMEX bill and the charge from the cleaners was $305.00. There was no way that was possible.

When I called the store they apologized, said the “charge machine” was broken - and delivered a $103.00 refund with my clothes

There are A LOT of cleaners in Hell’s Kitchen - AVOID EITHER BOTH THE VALET DRY CLEANER ON 56th & 57th STREET LOCATIONS.

A. TRAIN. WRECK.

originalText.text: I've been bringing my laundry here for wash and fold for the past 2 years. They've always been friendly, and the clothing comes back folded nicely and always on time.

text.text: I've been bringing my laundry here for wash and fold for the past 2 years. They've always been friendly, and the clothing comes back folded nicely and always on time.

originalText.text: They’re very polite and I loved their price! I highly recommend
